首里城再建へ、威勢良く伝統行事…「こんな時こそ盛り上げたい」

03 Nov 2019, 10:35



首里城の早期復元を願って旗を掲げる住民ら（３日午後２時１４分、那覇市で）＝高良亜矢子撮影

　首里城の早期再建への願いを込め、伝統行事の「旗頭（はたがしら）」が３日、周辺地域で披露され、威勢の良いかけ声が首里の街に響いた。
　毎年この時期に、古くからの文化を継承し、繁栄を願う意味の文字を書いたのぼり旗を掲げる伝統行事。火災の影響で、首里城周辺の自治会が集まる祭りは中止となったが、地元の首里大中町自治会は「一刻も早い復元に向けて住民を元気づけたい」と実施した。
　男性約３０人が高さ約６・５メートル、重さ約６０キロの旗を交代で持ち、町内を巡った。「サーサーサーサー」と声を出しながら旗を上下に動かすと、集まった住民や観光客から拍手がわいた。
　同自治会青年部長の亀川幸司さん（３２）は「首里城が焼け、ふさぎ込んでいる住民もいる。こんな時だからこそ全力で旗を掲げて盛り上げたい」と話した。
text:
To rebuild Shuri Castle, it ’s a traditional event… “I want to make this happen!”

03 Nov 2019, 10:35



Residents raising flags in the hope of the early restoration of Shuri Castle (2:14 pm, Naha City) = Ayako Takara

With a wish for the early rebuilding of Shuri Castle, the traditional event “Hatagashira” was performed in the surrounding area on the 3rd, and a dashing shout reverberated in Shuri.
Every year at this time, a traditional event that raises a banner that has written letters that are meant to succeed and prosper from the old culture. Due to the fire, the festival where residents 'associations around Shuri Castle gathered was cancelled, but the local Shuri Onaka Town Residents' Association said, “I want to invigorate the residents to restore as soon as possible.”
Approximately 30 men went around the town holding a flag of about 6.5 meters in height and weighing about 60 kg. Moving the flag up and down while saying “Surcer Sir Sa”, applause from the residents and tourists gathered.
”Koji Kamegawa, 32, the youth manager of the residents' association, said,“ Some castles are burned and blocked. That's why we want to raise the flag with all our strength. ”
